parameters.name: cacheNodeIds
parameters.description: If false, the algorithm will pass trees to executors to match instances with nodes. If true, the algorithm will cache node IDs for each instance. Caching can speed up training of deeper trees.

parameters.name: checkpointInterval
parameters.description: set checkpoint interval (>= 1) or disable checkpoint (-1). E.g. 10 means that the cache will get checkpointed every 10 iterations

parameters.name: impurity
parameters.description: Criterion used for information gain calculation (case-insensitive). Supported options: variance

parameters.name: lossType
parameters.description: Loss function which GBT tries to minimize (case-insensitive). Supported options: squared, absolute

parameters.name: maxBins
parameters.description: Max number of bins for discretizing continuous features.  Must be >=2 and >= number of categories for any categorical feature.

parameters.name: maxDepth
parameters.description: Maximum depth of the tree. (>= 0) E.g., depth 0 means 1 leaf node; depth 1 means 1 internal node + 2 leaf nodes.

parameters.name: maxMemoryInMB
parameters.description: Maximum memory in MB allocated to histogram aggregation.

parameters.name: minInfoGain
parameters.description: Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node.

parameters.name: minInstancesPerNode
parameters.description: Minimum number of instances each child must have after split.  If a split causes the left or right child to have fewer than minInstancesPerNode, the split will be discarded as invalid. Should be >= 1.

parameters.name: stepSize
parameters.description: Step size (a.k.a. learning rate) in interval (0, 1] for shrinking the contribution of each estimator.

parameters.name: subsamplingRate
parameters.description: Fraction of the training data used for learning each decision tree, in range (0, 1].
